title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:07 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
00:22 <jvdrean> has quit  
00:22 <mflorea> has quit  
01:46 <pturcotte> has joined #xwiki  
02:00 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
06:52 <sdumitriu> has quit  
07:28 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:51 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
08:54 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:14 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:44 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:22 <vmassol> tmortagne: was this caused by the action event change: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards/225/testReport/junit/org.xwiki.test.webstandards.framework/DefaultValidationTest/Validating\_XHTML\_validity\_for\_\_space\_Blog\_u002C\_page\_Categories\_executed\_with\_credentials\_Admin\_admin/ ?  
10:23 <+tmortagne> vmassol: yes and that's supposed to be already fixed  
10:23 <vmassol> starting a build  
10:24 <+tmortagne> vmassol: not sue enterprise has been built  
10:28 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:32 <+tmortagne> crap forgot to remove some now useless override  
10:34 <+tmortagne> should be ok now  
10:37 <+sburjan> good morning  
10:39 <+sburjan> the release is Monday, right ?  
10:39 <+sburjan> any idea if it will be delayed ?  
10:44 <vmassol> no indicator that it would but I guess it depends a lot on mflorea  
10:45 <vmassol> (for the app within minute core changes)  
10:53 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
11:03 <vmassol> has quit  
11:10 <jvdrean> has quit  
11:13 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
12:04 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
12:13 <JuanDaugherty> has joined #xwiki  
12:42 <+tmortagne> anyone knows why we add xwiki.work.dir=work in the xwiki.cfg file generated for XE?  
12:42 <+tmortagne> seems pretty useless to me  
12:54 <+sburjan> any idea when xwiki.cfg will be fully migrated to xwiki.proprieties ?  
12:54 <+sburjan> I mean.. are we slowly moving stuff on each release ?  
12:56 <+tmortagne> sburjan: it's not really that we moving stuff from xwiki.cfg to xwiki.properties but all that you can find in xwiki.cfg is related to oldcore/plugins and they will all be replaced by other systems with their own configuration that will go to xwiki.properties  
12:57 <+tmortagne> as for the when, I would say a veeeeeeeeery long time  
12:57 <+sburjan> yepp, the progress of getting rid of old-core is very slow  
12:57 <+sburjan> lot of code to be rewritten  
12:57 <+tmortagne> yep  
12:58 <+tmortagne> and not only they is also code that we keep like 1.0 syntax  
12:58 <+tmortagne> not very easy to get rid of this  
12:58 <+sburjan> yepp. but that is in rendering, right ? not in old-core  
12:59 <+tmortagne> make me think I need to check if there is some legacy code related stuff in xwiki.cfg to remove them  
12:59 <+tmortagne> sburjan: no  
12:59 <+tmortagne> we keep the old 1.0 syntax rendering system  
13:00 <+sburjan> so 1.0 rendering is diffrent from xwiki-rendering from github  top level project  
13:00 <+tmortagne> what we have in rendering is just a converter from 1.0 to 2.0 syntax that is doing what it can two convert two thing that are really not working the same way  
13:01 <+tmortagne> s/two/to/  
13:01 <+tmortagne> old 1.0 rendering is on oldcore  
13:01 <+sburjan> i see  
13:02 <+sburjan> i think I was refering to the rendering project, the one independent with xwiki  
13:03 <+tmortagne> yep this one only have a converter from 1.0 to 2.0 syntax implemented and rendering parser but there is still (and will always be) stuff hard to convert  
13:03 <+tmortagne> so if you want the proper 1.0 syntax behavior there is no other choice than using oldcore  
13:27 <JuanDaugherty> dunno if it's already addressed but 3.1 thinks Chrome is Safari, i dunno maybe implication is webkit based = safari oder; At least that's what the editing pop-up scary sez  
13:55 <pturcotte> has quit  
14:16 <lucaa1> has joined #xwiki  
14:19 <lucaa> has quit  
14:22 <lucaa1> has quit

15:00 <mflorea> has quit  
15:01 <lucaa> has quit  
15:01 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
15:03 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
15:03 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: Hi  
15:04 <+tmortagne> any idea why we have xwiki.work.dir=work in xwiki.cfg ?  
15:04 <+tmortagne> I mean what is the need ? I know how it ends up here ;)  
15:05 <@sdumitriu> Hm, is it commented or enabled?  
15:06 <+tmortagne> it's added during XE build so it's enabled  
15:06 <+tmortagne> but I don't see why XE if it's even useful  
15:06 <+tmortagne> it's added using xwikiCfgAdditionalProperties  
15:06 <+tmortagne> $xwikiCfgAdditionalProperties  
15:06 <@sdumitriu> If you remove it, does it still work?  
15:07 <@sdumitriu> Might be some legacy  
15:07 <@sdumitriu> You could git blame to see who added that line  
15:07 <+tmortagne> I removed it from XEM since a long time AFAIK actually  
15:07 <lucaa> has quit  
15:07 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
15:07 <+tmortagne> I actually removed it because I tough is was not in XE as far I a rememberbut seems I was wrong  
15:08 <+tmortagne> it's pretty old AFAIK

15:10 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: I removed it from XE along with my refactoring, will see if someone complains
